greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of n-th powers of the three roots of x^3-2*x^2-x+1.
comment: a(n) is x1^n + x2^n + x3^n, where x1, x2, x3 are the roots of the polynomial x^3-2*x^2-x+1.
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Kai Wang, Fibonacci Numbers And Trigonometric Functions Outline, (2019).
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,1,-1).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[-(x^2 + 4 x - 3)/(x^3 - x^2 - 2 x + 1), {x, 0, 32}], x] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 14 2016 *)
results.author: _Kai Wang_, Jul 14 2016
